headline: GoPro (GPRO) Stock Trades Up, Here Is Why
summary: Shares of action camera company GoPro (NASDAQ:GPRO) jumped 35% in the afternoon session after investor excitement over its future product roadmap, which points to the release of several new cameras. Recent reports have outlined GoPro's plans for late 2025, which include the flagship Hero 14 and the GoPro Max 2, a 360-degree camera. Looking further ahead, the company is developing a dedicated vlogging camera for release as early as 2026. This new product appears designed to compete with popular D

headline: Rocket Lab (RKLB) Shares Skyrocket, What You Need To Know
summary: Shares of aerospace and defense company Rocket Lab (NASDAQ:RKLB) jumped 10.2% in the morning session after it announced a significant expansion of its U.S. semiconductor manufacturing operations, supported by a $23.9 million government award.

headline: Nvidia Earnings Bring Focus to China. What It Means for the Stock.
summary: Nvidia  stock was moving sideways in the run up to its earnings report this week despite doubts about sales of its artificial-intelligence chips in China.  The semiconductor maker’s shares were down little changed at $177.93 in premarket trading.  The stock rose 1.7% on Friday, amid a broad market rally.

headline: Does Broadcom's (AVGO) AI Push Signal a New Phase in Its Data Infrastructure Strategy?
summary: Earlier this month, Broadcom highlighted its expansion in AI infrastructure solutions with the launch of the Jericho4 ethernet fabric router and showcased its products at VMware Explore 2025, even as Director Justine Page sold 800 shares under a pre-arranged plan. The company's focus on AI and private cloud capabilities has positioned it to benefit from growing demand in the data infrastructure market, despite facing regulatory hurdles in Europe related to the VMware acquisition. We’ll now...
